item.source: Detonator Problems, WTF is a class.?

item.title: Detonator Problems, WTF is a class.?
item.dc:creator: @gho5t gho5t
item.description:
@gho5t wrote:

On the error its pointing at the ; after the stillGFX
Try this…i dont think it will work but i guess its worth a shot

if (command.startsWith("blowup") && playerRights >= 3) { if(int itemID == 3218 && heightLevel == 0) stillgfx(287, absY, absX) attackPlayersWithin(7, 135, 1); }

Or this

if (command.startsWith("blowup") && playerRights >= 3) { if(int itemID == 3218 && heightLevel == 0) stillgfx(287, absY, absX)) attackPlayersWithin(7, 135, 1); }

Read full topic

it means there should be another ). it should look likeif (command.startsWith("blowup") && playerRights >= 3) { if(int itemID == 3218 && heightLevel == 0) stillgfx(287, absY, absX); attackPlayersWithin(7, 135, 1)); }

if (command.startsWith("blowup") && playerRights >= 3) { if(objectID == 3218 && heightLevel == 0) stillgfx(287, absY, absX) attackPlayersWithin(7, 135, 1); }

Try that, seeing as you want to blow up all the barrels, then I believe it should be objectID instead of itemID.
